alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Greenville Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:40PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson, southwestern Polk and northeastern Greenville Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Hendersonville, or near Jones Gap State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saluda, Tigerville, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Flat Rock, Dupont State Forest, Tuxedo, North Saluda Reservoir and Glassy Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
